title: Integrated ScratchJr Programming Education for Developing Computational Thinking

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental computer literacy and understanding of logical reasoning
context.additional_context: Conducted in a smartphone-centric limited-technology environment with formative assessment-focused learning effectiveness measurement. Approaches differentiate learners by role: students or job seekers

learning_goals: Learners can design simple programs by applying computational thinking concepts such as sequencing, events, and parallelism using ScratchJr.
Learners can enhance problem-solving skills through testing, debugging, code reuse, and remixing.
Learners can propose creative solutions by integrating computational thinking into scientific problem-solving.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
